alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 12 at 10:01PM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches across the Jackson County Foothills * WHERE...The foothills of Jackson County above 2500 feet. This includes highway 227, 140 and Dead Indian Memorial Road. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult in high remote terrain. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
